intro: Crassocephalum cusimbua, commonly known as the African blue daisy, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads, which are surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. The plant has a sprawling growth habit and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and ragworts. Crassocephalum cusimbua is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its use in traditional medicine.
